description: This is a general view of the account.

panels.description: This panel shows the total current active installations in the account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(installationid)
FROM
clusterinstallation
WHERE
state = 'stable'

panels.title: Active Installations

panels.description: This panel shows the total failed installations in the account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(installationid)
FROM
clusterinstallation
WHERE
state = 'failed'

panels.title: Failed Installations

panels.description: This panel shows the total failed installations in the account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(installationid)
FROM
clusterinstallation
WHERE
state = 'reconciling'

panels.title: Reconciling Installations

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
clusterID, installationid
FROM
clusterinstallation
WHERE
state = 'reconciling'

panels.description: This panel shows the current active clusters in the account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(id)
FROM
cluster
WHERE
state = 'stable'

panels.title: Active Clusters

panels.description: This panel shows the total failed clusters in the account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(id)
FROM
cluster
WHERE
state = 'failed'

panels.title: Failed Clusters

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
NOW () as time,
count(id)
FROM cluster
WHERE state = 'creation-requested' OR state = 'provisioning-requested' OR state = 'upgrade-requested'

panels.description: This panel shows the current number of used ELBs in comparison to the current AWS limit.
panels.title: Load Balancers Available

panels.description: The total number of failed pods in the account.
panels.title: Pods in Fail State

panels.description: The total number of pods in CrashLoopBackOff state in the account.
panels.title: Pods in CrashLoopBackOff State

panels.description: This panel shows the cpu usage per Cluster ID (%)
panels.title: Avg CPU Usage by Cluster ID

panels.description: This panel shows the memory usage per Cluster ID (%)
panels.title: Avg Memory Usage by Cluster ID

panels.description: This panel shows the network usage per Cluster ID (%)
panels.title: Network Usage by ClusterID

panels.description: This panel shows the disk usage per Cluster ID (%)

targets.expr: avg((node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype!~"rootfs|selinuxfs|autofs|rpc_pipefs|tmpfs", mountpoint="/", clusterID != "C&C"} - node_filesystem_free_bytes{fstype!~"rootfs|selinuxfs|autofs|rpc_pipefs|tmpfs", mountpoint="/", clusterID != "C&C"}) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype!~"rootfs|selinuxfs|autofs|rpc_pipefs|tmpfs", mountpoint="/", clusterID != "C&C"}) by (clusterID)* 100

panels.title: Disk Usage by Cluster ID

panels.description: This panel shows the stable Cluster and Installation IDs.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
clusterID, installationID
FROM
clusterinstallation
WHERE
state = 'stable'

panels.title: Stable Cluster and Installation IDs

panels.description: This table shows all the installations running more than a week.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
id, dns, to_timestamp(@createat/1000) AT TIME ZONE 'UTC'
FROM 
installation 
WHERE
state = 'stable' AND (to_timestamp(@createat/1000) < current_date-interval '7 days')
ORDER BY 
 timezone DESC;

panels.title: Installations Running More than 7 Days (Oldest First)

panels.description: This table shows all the installations running more than a week.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
cluster.id, cluster.size, cluster.allowInstallations, COUNT(clusterinstallation.id), to_timestamp(@cluster.createat/1000) AT TIME ZONE 'UTC'
FROM 
cluster
LEFT JOIN clusterinstallation on clusterinstallation.clusterid = cluster.id
WHERE 
cluster.state = 'stable' AND (clusterinstallation.deleteat = 0 OR clusterinstallation.deleteat IS NULL)
GROUP BY cluster.id
ORDER BY 
 timezone DESC;

panels.title: Cluster Size and Installation Counts

title: Account View
